summary: The United States, by virtue of Alaska, is an Arctic nation. The Coast Guard has assessed evolving risks in the region—including geopolitical tensions and climate change—and has taken steps to manage them. For example, it deployed ships to the area and participates in training exercises. But it hasn't always spent as much time as it planned for these activities. The Coast Guard hasn't fully tracked...
title: Coast Guard: Complete Performance and Operational Data Would Better Clarify Arctic Resource Needs
